alert.note: Alert for Denton; Parker; Tarrant; Wise (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 08 at 10:19PM CDT until September 08 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Wise County in north central Texas... Southwestern Denton County in north central Texas... East central Parker County in north central Texas... Western Tarrant County in north central Texas... * Until 1115 PM CDT. * At 1018 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Pelican Bay, or over Briar, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Fort Worth, Haltom City, Keller, Southlake, Watauga, Benbrook, Saginaw, White Settlement, Azle, Trophy Club, River Oaks, Sansom Park, Lake Worth, Eagle Mountain, Briar, North Richland Hills, Roanoke, Pecan Acres, Reno, and Westworth Village. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35W between mile markers 52 and 71. Interstate 20 between mile markers 423 and 432. Interstate 30 between mile markers 1 and 14. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection get inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
